content: alaskan waffle shawl designed by buttonnose crochet p ag e | 2 skill level adventurous beginner materials 2- 3 caron big cakes 551m/603 yds per cake 10ply/worsted/#4 weight sample used 2 x honey glazed 6 5mm hook scissors needle to sew in ends size 50 row + border = 62 / 157cm top of shawl x 30 /76cm depth of shawl 60 row + border = 72 / 182cm top of shawl x 34 /86cm depth of shawl gauge 14 sts x 10 row = 4 /10cm x 4 /10cm stitches & abbreviations us terms uk terms slip_stitch slip_stitch st/s stitch/es space space magic_ring magic_ring chain chain double_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet/ treble fpdc fptr front post double_crochet/ treble yo insert hook from front to back and around to the front again around the post of the indicated st yo pull through a loop *yo pull through 2 loops* x 2 pattern notes  pattern is written in us terms with uk terms listed in stitches used  this pattern can be made in any weight yarn since this is a shawl and not a blanket it is recommended to use a hook 1 2 sizes bigger than recommended to create a nice drape in the finished fabric  alaskan waffle shawl is a reversible pattern therefore there is no right or wrong side of the pattern  the top edge will curve this is a design element  chain 3 at beginning of row counts as a double_crochet  *-* star asterisks represent a repeat of stitches  - brackets represent a group of stitches video tutorial a video tutorial can be found here for this pattern alaskan waffle shawl © buttonnose crochet 2019 p ag e | 3 pattern make a magic_ring or chain 4 slip_stitch to first chain to form a ring row 1  chain 3 counts as double_crochet here and throughout 2 double_crochet chain 1 3 double_crochet into ring turn 6 double_crochet 1 x chain 1 row 2  chain 3 2 double_crochet in same st fpdc around next 2 sts  2 double_crochet chain 1 2 double_crochet into chain 1 corner  fpdc around next 2 sts 3 double_crochet into 3rd chain of previous row turn 10 double_crochet 4 fpdc 1 x chain 1 row 3  chain 3 2 double_crochet in same st fpdc around next 2 sts double_crochet next 2 sts fpdc around next 2 sts  2 double_crochet chain 1 2 double_crochet in chain 1 corner  fpdc around next 2 sts double_crochet next 2 sts fpdc around next 2 sts 3 double_crochet in 3rd chain of previous row turn 14 double_crochet 8 fpdc 1 x chain 1 row 4  chain 3 2 double_crochet in same st fpdc around next 2 sts *double_crochet next 2 sts fpdc around next 2 sts* repeat to corner  2 double_crochet chain 1 2 double_crochet in chain 1 space fpdc around next 2 sts  repeat * to * to end of row 3 double_crochet in
